longInfo:
Passport required.
- Passports and other documents accepted for entry must be
  valid for the period of intended stay. 
Passport Exemptions:
- Holders of emergency or temporary passports.

Visa required, except for A max. stay of 30 days for holders
of a visa issued by Canada or USA, valid for the period of
intended stay, issued to nationals of Lithuania traveling as
tourists. Passenger must also hold a vaccination certificate
for Measles, Rubella and Polio. 
Visa required, except for Holders of passports that include an
Unconditional Landing stamp issued by Jamaica.  
Visa Issuance:
Visa required, except for Nationals of Lithuania traveling as
tourist, can obtain a visa on arrival. Fee: USD 100.-. 
Minors:
- Foreign minors (under 18 years of age) if traveling with a
  school group; 
- WARNING! In accordance with European Union (EU) Legislation,
  all minors who are nationals of Lithuania will be expected
  to hold their own passport or National ID Card (where
  applicable) when departing from Bulgaria, Croatia, Cyprus,
  Romania or a Schengen Member State . 
Additional Information:
- Visitors are required to hold proof of sufficient funds to
  cover their stay and documents for their next destination. 
Warning:
- Nationals and alien residents of Jamaica, who have visited
  Guinea, Liberia, Nigeria or Sierra Leone within the last 28
  days are subject to screening and health checks. Passengers
  may be quarantined for further assessment.
- Nationals of Lithuania who have visited or have transited
  Guinea, Liberia or Sierra Leone within the last 28 days will
  be refused entry. 
- Visitors must hold return/onward tickets
vaccination:
Vaccination against yellow fever required if arriving within 6
days after leaving or transiting countries with risk of yellow
fever transmission For details, click here.

Exempt from Yellow Fever vaccination:
- Children under 1 year of age.
